title.narrative: USAID DO3 - Political Parties Development Project

description.narrative: (Pakistan): The Political Party Development Project (PPDP) seeks to support political parties to more effectively respond to constituent interests and concerns. The program wills strengthen the capacity of parties to effectively contribute to developing inclusive and research based policy, and assist them to implement internationally recognized standards for internal democracy and transparency.The National Democratic Institute for International Affairs (NDI) and its partners anticipate that within the program's fourth year, parties will continue to focus on party policy and manifesto development as well as the formulation of legislative agenda. With a focus on strengthening participation of grass-roots party members, the policy development process includes building institutional capacity in training, research, analysis, and decision-making. At this stage, the project is building on the work completed during the first cycle of activities that informed election platforms in the general elections.~PPDP~integrates democratic governance throughout the policy cycle, highlighting research-based policy development that includes collecting input from constituents and party-members.~NDI~will assist those parties who wish to translate platforms into inclusive, informed policy and legislation.
